comments:
N20050607

1. New workspace
2. Check out the following projects from HEAD:
- org.eclipse.jdt.core
- org.eclipse.jdt.core.tests.builder
- org.eclipse.jdt.core.tests.compiler
- org.eclipse.jdt.core.tests.model
- org.eclipse.test.performance
- org.eclipse.test.performance.win32
3. Open RunJDTCoretests
4. Run As... > JUnit Plug-in Tests
Observe: The tests don't run and you get the following in the console:
"Error:  " java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: No Classloader found for plug-in
org.eclipse.jdt.core.tests.model

N20050607-0010
I just loaded the 6 projects from HEAD and the tests started just fine (I found
13262 tests and they are running).

Do you have something else in your workspace?
Can you consistently reproduce it with a new workspace?

Created an attachment (id=22519)
patched org.eclipse.pde.core.jar

Jerome, does running Eclipse with the attached JAR fix the problem? If so, this
would be a duplicate of bug 98638.
Yes the patch fixes the problem. Thanks !
Jerome, are you running your workspace on FAT32 or NTFS?
I'm running the workspace on NTFS

Darn... that was the only theory we had for explaining why some people see this
while others don't.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 98638 ***
